answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your medical problems. The symptoms could be due to pinched nerve in your spine, shingles (if there is burning sensation and/or mild rash or redness), sweat dermatitis, or peripheral neuropathy due to diabetes or Lyme’s or lupus or thyroid disorders. Please consult your doctor (GP or neurologist) regarding this. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

Hello,Seriously your problem is quite sensitive one. The pain you are describing may be caused by many reasons. It may happen when you hurt your back by lifting something or straining hard or blood is not circulated properly in your body. But these are only expectation on the basis of information provided by you.That means problem may be different also. So I just want to suggest that you should firstly concern doctor near you and follow the prescription and test to find out the exact problem for proper treatment. Don’t worry you will be good within few days.

question: Hi. I am a 25 year old girl in good health. Been having strange pain on my left side chest for 3 weeks now. Pain goes from my ribs under my boob up to my shoulder, where my collar bone is and down my back around the shoulder blade and side of my ribs. I sometimes feel electric shock sensations right near the middle of my back where my bra line hits. But I will also feel what feels like fluid or something moving around back there some times when I move and then I get more pain. Not sure who I should go see?
title: Strange back and ribs pain.
